1.text: Choose the freshest lemons you can find; hand pick, if possible.

2.text: Sort the lemons into two groups, and then wash and dry them.

3.text: Store whole, blemish-free lemons in a plastic bag in the refrigerator.

4.text: Cut around blemished sections of the lemons.

5.text: Using a citrus zester, shave off lemon peel from lemon.

6.text: Use lemon fruit for juice and piths for pectin.

7.text: Place lemon zest in a glass mason jar and freeze.

8.text: Using a potato peeler, cut off lemon peel in wide ribbons.

9.text: Mix equal amounts kosher salt and sugar in a bowl.

10.text: Add a few dried peppercorns, allspice berries, bay leaves, and cloves to the bottom of the mason jar.

11.text: Add a layer of salt/sugar to the mason jar, then a layer of lemon peel.

12.text: Place lid and rim onto mason jar, close tightly, and shake several times.

14.text: Put on latex or non-latex gloves.

15.text: Roll lemons a few times, with pressure, on a cutting board.

17.text: Zest lemon skin with citrus zester.

18.text: Place zested half-lemon in lemon squeezer and juice.

19.text: Filter lemon juice at least once.

20.text: Save spent lemon piths in a plastic bag.

21.text: Pour filtered lemon juice into ice cube trays, and freeze thoroughly.

22.text: Empty ice cube trays into plastic bags.
